verses.verse: Then <S%H347>Job<s%> <S%H6030>answered,<s%>
<S%H551>"Truly<s%> I <S%H3045>know<s%> that it is <S%H582>so,<s%> but how can man be <S%H6663>just<s%> with <S%H410>God?<s%>
If he <S%H2654>is<s%> pleased to <S%H7378>contend<s%> with <S%H6030>him,<s%> he can't answer him <S%H259>one<s%> time in a <S%H505>thousand.<s%>
God who is <S%H2450>wise<s%> in <S%H3824>heart,<s%> and <S%H533>mighty<s%> in <S%H3581>strength:<s%> who has <S%H7185>hardened<s%> himself against <S%H7999>him,<s%> and prospered?
He <S%H6275>removes<s%> the <S%H2022>mountains,<s%> and they <S%H3045>don't<s%> know <S%H2015>it,<s%> when he overturns them in his <S%H639>anger.<s%>
He <S%H7264>shakes<s%> the <S%H776>earth<s%> out of its <S%H4725>place.<s%> Its <S%H5982>pillars<s%> <S%H6426>tremble.<s%>
He <S%H559>commands<s%> the <S%H2775>sun,<s%> and it <S%H2224>doesn't<s%> rise, and seals <S%H2856>up<s%> the <S%H3556>stars.<s%>
He alone stretches <S%H5186>out<s%> the <S%H8064>heavens,<s%> and <S%H1869>treads<s%> on the <S%H1116>waves<s%> of the <S%H3220>sea.<s%>
He <S%H6213>makes<s%> the <S%H5906>Bear,<s%> <S%H3685>Orion,<s%> and the <S%H3598>Pleiades,<s%> and the <S%H2315>rooms<s%> of the <S%H8486>south.<s%>
He <S%H6213>does<s%> great <S%H1419>things<s%> <S%H369>past<s%> finding <S%H2714>out;<s%> <S%H6381>yes,<s%> marvelous things without <S%H4557>number.<s%>
<S%H5674>Behold,<s%> he goes by <S%H7200>me,<s%> and I don't see <S%H2498>him.<s%> He passes on <S%H995>also,<s%> but I don't perceive him.
<S%H2862>Behold,<s%> he snatches away. Who can <S%H7725>hinder<s%> <S%H559>him?<s%> Who will ask <S%H6213>him,<s%> 'What are you doing?'
<S%H433>"God<s%> will not <S%H7725>withdraw<s%> his <S%H639>anger.<s%> The <S%H5826>helpers<s%> of <S%H7293>Rahab<s%> stoop under <S%H7817>him.<s%>
How much less shall I <S%H6030>answer<s%> <S%H977>him,<s%> And choose my words to argue with <S%H1697>him?<s%>
Though I were <S%H6663>righteous,<s%> yet I <S%H6030>wouldn't<s%> answer <S%H2603>him.<s%> I would make supplication to my <S%H8199>judge.<s%>
If I had <S%H7121>called,<s%> and he had <S%H6030>answered<s%> <S%H539>me,<s%> yet I wouldn't believe that he <S%H238>listened<s%> to my <S%H6963>voice.<s%>
For he <S%H7779>breaks<s%> me with a <S%H8183>storm,<s%> and <S%H7235>multiplies<s%> my <S%H6482>wounds<s%> without <S%H2600>cause.<s%>
He will not <S%H5414>allow<s%> me to <S%H7725>catch<s%> my <S%H7307>breath,<s%> but <S%H7646>fills<s%> me with <S%H4472>bitterness.<s%>
If it is a matter of <S%H3581>strength,<s%> <S%H533>behold,<s%> he is mighty! If of <S%H4941>justice,<s%> <S%H3259><s%> 'Who,' says he, 'will summon me?'
Though I am <S%H6663>righteous,<s%> my own <S%H6310>mouth<s%> shall <S%H7561>condemn<s%> <S%H8535>me.<s%> Though I am blameless, it shall prove me <S%H6140>perverse.<s%>
I am <S%H8535>blameless.<s%> I <S%H3045>don't<s%> respect <S%H5315>myself.<s%> I <S%H3988>despise<s%> my <S%H5315>life.<s%>
"It is all <S%H259>the<s%> <S%H559>same.<s%> Therefore I say he <S%H3615>destroys<s%> the <S%H8535>blameless<s%> and the <S%H7563>wicked.<s%>
If the <S%H7752>scourge<s%> <S%H4191>kills<s%> <S%H6597>suddenly,<s%> he will <S%H3932>mock<s%> at the <S%H4531>trial<s%> of the <S%H5355>innocent.<s%>

The <S%H776>earth<s%> is <S%H5414>given<s%> into the <S%H3027>hand<s%> of the <S%H7563>wicked.<s%> He <S%H3680>covers<s%> the <S%H6440>faces<s%> of its <S%H8199>judges.<s%> If not <S%H645>he,<s%> then who is it?
"Now my <S%H3117>days<s%> are <S%H7043>swifter<s%> than a <S%H7323>runner.<s%> They flee <S%H1272>away,<s%> they <S%H7200>see<s%> no <S%H2896>good,<s%>
They have passed <S%H2498>away<s%> <S%H5973>as<s%> the <S%H16>swift<s%> <S%H591>ships,<s%> as the <S%H5404>eagle<s%> that <S%H2907>swoops<s%> on the <S%H400>prey.<s%>
If I <S%H559>say,<s%> <S%H7911><s%> 'I will forget my <S%H7879>complaint,<s%> I will put <S%H5800>off<s%> my sad <S%H6440>face,<s%> and cheer <S%H1082>up;<s%>'
I am <S%H3025>afraid<s%> of all my <S%H6094>sorrows,<s%> I <S%H3045>know<s%> that you will not hold me <S%H5352>innocent.<s%>
I shall be <S%H7561>condemned.<s%> Why then do I <S%H3021>labor<s%> in <S%H1892>vain?<s%>
If I <S%H7364>wash<s%> myself <S%H7950>with<s%> <S%H4325>snow,<s%> and <S%H2141>cleanse<s%> my <S%H3709>hands<s%> with <S%H1252>lye,<s%>
<S%H227>yet<s%> you will <S%H2881>plunge<s%> me in the <S%H7845>ditch.<s%> My own <S%H8008>clothes<s%> shall abhor <S%H8581>me.<s%>
For he is not a <S%H376>man,<s%> as I <S%H6030>am,<s%> that I should answer <S%H935>him,<s%> that we should come <S%H3162>together<s%> in <S%H4941>judgment.<s%>
There <S%H3426>is<s%> no <S%H3198>umpire<s%> between <S%H7896>us,<s%> that might lay his <S%H3027>hand<s%> on us <S%H8147>both.<s%>
Let him <S%H5493>take<s%> his <S%H7626>rod<s%> <S%H5493>away<s%> from <S%H367>me.<s%> Let his terror not make me <S%H367>afraid;<s%>
then I would <S%H1696>speak,<s%> and not fear <S%H3372>him,<s%> for I am not so in myself.
